span.p: Construction on the New Elementary Building continues to move forward with more progress this week including underground sanitary and underground electric work. Read more and see photos in this weekly report from Garmann/Miller. WEEKLY REPORT

Yearbook News & Senior Information: Slide-Show & Yearbook Ads: Please send DIGITAL IMAGES for the senior slide show to Katherine Glenn at reflector.elida@gmail.com. You must include a CURRENT picture of your senior; other images are optional. Typically we include a baby picture, a picture from middle school, and the senior picture. Senior pictures DO NOT need to be professionally taken. There is no deadline for submissions at this time; we will notify you of any changes after May 1st. We apologize, but we cannot take hard copies of pictures at this time. The 2020 Reflector Yearbook: "Unleashed" is still for sale online for $75 at yearbookforever.com.

a.title: Click to read more about: Reflector Yearbook & Senior Info.

div.a: Read More about Reflector Yearbook & Senior Info.

span.p: It's time to look ahead to youth football! Use this SIGN-UP FORM and send to Mark Kline 7395 Pike Ave. Gomer, Ohio 45809.

Construction on the new elementary building continues with many new developments this week including finishing the footers for the building and connecting the domestic water line. Next week goal to put up the storm shelter walls. See more details and great photos in the CONSTRUCTION UPDATE.

div.a: 4.6.2020 Share Photos for the Reflector Yearbook

span.p: Students and staff can submit pictures and video of themselves while we are out of school to be used in the High School "Reflector" Yearbook. Anyone can get a mobile app at either the App Store or Google Play, or they can go to the yearbookforever.com website and upload there. Our password to submit images is #Bulldawg20.

p.span: Please read the SCHOOL CLOSURE UPDATE from Superintendent Mengerink with information regarding grading, school work, testing, events and other items.

All upcoming drivers education classes scheduled in Elida High School are canceled until further notice. If questions please contact the Drivers Education Training Manager Mr. Sam Boyer at 419-235-3776.

span.p: During Governor DeWine's press conference on Monday, March 30th, he announced school buildings would remain closed through May 1st. All learning will continue to be done online. Please continue to keep up with your school work through Schoology!

We encourage our seniors to take a look at the 14 local scholarships available and to apply. These are the scholarships that are awarded each year at senior honors night in May. LINK TO SCHOLARSHIPS Even though we are experiencing the school closure, our local scholarship providers still want to be able to distribute scholarships this year to our seniors of 2020, but students need to apply and submit those applications to us in order to be considered.

Please read this message from Supt. Mengerink regarding the process of Online Learning, staff assistance and working hours and other updates. If you have questions/problems logging into Schoology, please e-mail help@elida.k12.oh.us.
Elida will distribute meals to students beginning on Monday, March 23rd. Please read this LETTER from Supt. Mengerink with complete details.

div.a: 3-18-2020 Building Offices Closed until Further Notice

span.p: As of March 18th, offices are now closed until further notice. Please do not place a call to the buildings as those calls will go unanswered. Your best source of getting assistance is your child’s teacher(s)

div.a: 3-17-2020 Elida Social Workers Provide Family Assistance

p.span: District social workers are available both via email and schoology message to help with any mental health or parent support sessions from 8:00-2:00. Below is a list of building social worker names and methods of contact. We are working to develop other alternative methods for contact that will be announced once finalized. High School: Stacy McAdams smcadams@elida.k12.oh.us OR Stacy McAdams on Schoology Middle School: Jennifer Knippen jknippen@elida.k12.oh.us OR Jennifer Knippen on Schoology Elementary School: Stefanie Atwater satwater@elida.k12.oh.us OR Stefanie Atwater on Schoology. If you are in a crisis please call the Hopeline at: 1-800-567-HOPE (4673) or Text: 741741 For additional resources and communication, please visit Elida Counseling and Social Work group on Schoology!

div.a: 3-16-2020 Charter to Offer Free Access to Wi-Fi & Broadband

span.p: Parents who don’t have internet at home can get free broadband, including installation, from Spectrum for 60 days. Spectrum parent company Charter announced that, starting today, they will offer free Spectrum broadband and wi-fi for 60 days to households with K-12 and/or college students. To sign up, call (844) 488-8395. MORE INFORMATION.

Following Governor Mike DeWine's announcement on March 12, 2020, Elida Schools will be closed BEGINNING Monday, March 16-April 3, 2020. We have information for families and resources available at this page: Information and Updates Here

Allen County Public Health is monitoring the coronavirus and coordinating planning efforts across the area and so is Elida School District. For more information and FAQ's, please see the PDF factsheet from the Center for Disease Control or visit www.cdc.gov/COVID19. Continue to check back for updated information.

p.span: Due to the cancelation of school on Feb. 27th, the last day of school for students will now be Thursday, May 28th with a TWO-HOUR EARLY RELEASE. Any additional cancelations will result in another make-up day.

span.p: Registration for new, incoming kindergarten students begins on Monday, January 13, 2020. The registration packet is linked HERE. Kindergarten screening will be Thursday, May 21st and Friday May, 22nd at Elida Immanuel Church from 8:00-3:00. Any questions call the elementary office 419-331-7901.
